name: Lithodora
climate: Lithodora prefers a temperate climate and thrives best in regions with mild winters.
It can adapt to coastal climates, tolerating salt spray and windy conditions.
This plant is well-suited for Mediterranean climates, warm and dry summers are ideal.
Avoid areas with extreme cold, as hard freezing temperatures can damage the plant.
sunlight: Lithodora requires full sun to thrive, as abundant sunlight encourages vibrant blooms.
Partial shade can be tolerated, especially in hotter regions to avoid leaf scorch.
Ensure the plant receives at least six hours of direct sunlight daily for optimal growth.
A location with morning sun and afternoon shade can help prevent overheating.
watering: Regular watering is necessary, especially during the plant's first growing season.
Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged, as overwatering can be harmful.
Reduce watering frequency during the dormant winter months to prevent root rot.
Utilize drip irrigation or soaker hoses to deliver water slowly and evenly.
soil: Lithodora prefers acidic, well-drained soil high in organic matter for ideal growth.
Avoid heavy clay soils as they retain too much moisture, leading to root rot.
Incorporating sand or perlite can improve drainage and prevent waterlogging issues.
A slightly sandy soil structure is preferred, mimicking its natural rocky habitats.
extra_care_tip: Prune Lithodora after flowering to maintain shape and encourage dense, bushy growth.
Mulching around the base helps retain moisture and keeps roots cool during hot weather.
